text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that assigning responsibilities to the tenant does not remove the owner\u2019s responsibility for common or shared areas. The candidate answer addresses this directly in the section on 'Primary Blame' under 'Your Shared/Secondary Liability,' stating: 'As owner/RP for premises (FSO/HSWA s.4), duty to ensure common safety (e.g., inspect shared space).' Furthermore, the introductory section on shared premises notes: 'As owner, you're likely RP for the building fabric/common areas; the lessee for their area/equipment.' This clearly implies that the owner retains responsibility for shared aspects despite delegating duties to the tenant.", "criterion_id": "61540037-65b5-4926-9628-43ec17bf3eec"}
